## Instructions

Run the task-work skill in loop mode:

```
/task-work loop
```

Loop mode means: no confirmations, auto-resolve decisions, automation-eligible tasks only.

Exit when task work is complete or no eligible tasks remain.

availableCommands.name: kspec
availableCommands.description: Use kspec CLI for task and spec management. Invoke when working with tasks, tracking work, capturing ideas, checking session status, or managing specs in this project. (project)

availableCommands.name: meta
availableCommands.description: Manage session context - focus, threads, questions, and observations. Use when tracking what you're working on, managing parallel work streams, or capturing friction points. (project)

availableCommands.name: pr
availableCommands.description: Create a pull request from current work. Handles branch creation, commits, push, and PR creation. (project)

availableCommands.name: reflect
availableCommands.description: Reflect on a session to identify learnings, friction points, and improvements. Captures valuable insights for future sessions. (project)

availableCommands.name: spec
availableCommands.description: Specification management - creating, organizing, and maintaining spec items with acceptance criteria and traits. (project)

availableCommands.name: spec-plan
availableCommands.description: Translate an approved plan into specs with acceptance criteria and derived tasks. Use after plan mode when transitioning to implementation. (project)

availableCommands.name: task-work
availableCommands.description: Work on a kspec task with proper lifecycle - verify, start, note, submit, PR, complete. (project)

availableCommands.name: triage
availableCommands.description: Triage inbox items systematically. Analyzes items against spec/tasks, categorizes them, and processes using spec-first approach. (project)

availableCommands.name: compact
availableCommands.description: Clear conversation history but keep a summary in context. Optional: /compact [instructions for summarization]

availableCommands.name: init
availableCommands.description: Initialize a new CLAUDE.md file with codebase documentation

availableCommands.name: pr-comments
availableCommands.description: Get comments from a GitHub pull request

availableCommands.name: security-review
availableCommands.description: Complete a security review of the pending changes on the current branch

rawInput.description: Get task details for monorepo initialization

content.text: Get task details for monorepo initialization

toolResponse.stdout:
Initialize pnpm monorepo workspace
────────────────────────────────────────
ULID:      01KG1TCHT7HG62QECKPQ8PD996
Slugs:     init-monorepo
Type:      task
Status:    pending
Priority:  1
Automation: eligible
Tags:      phase-0
Created:   2026-01-28T08:09:14.822Z

─── Notes ───
[2026-01-28T08:11:30.912Z] @claude:
## Goal
Set up the pnpm monorepo workspace structure with all 6 packages configured.

## Files
- package.json - Root package with workspace scripts
- pnpm-workspace.yaml - Workspace package definitions
- packages/core/package.json - @kynetic-bot/core
- packages/messaging/package.json - @kynetic-bot/messaging
- packages/channels/package.json - @kynetic-bot/channels
- packages/memory/package.json - @kynetic-bot/memory
- packages/agent/package.json - @kynetic-bot/agent
- packages/bot/package.json - @kynetic-bot/bot

## Dependencies
None - this is the first task.

## Implementation
1. Create root package.json with pnpm workspace configuration
2. Create pnpm-workspace.yaml with packages/* glob
3. Create each package directory with package.json containing:
   - name: @kynetic-bot/{package-name}
   - main: dist/index.js
   - types: dist/index.d.ts
   - scripts: build, test, lint
4. Add workspace dependencies between packages (e.g., bot depends on all others)

## Acceptance Criteria
- AC-1: pnpm workspace configured with all 6 packages
- AC-2: Each package has package.json with name, main, types
- AC-3: pnpm install succeeds from root

## Verification
Run pnpm install from project root and verify no errors.

rawInput.command: ls -la | grep -E "(package.json|pnpm-workspace.yaml)" && ls -d packages/* 2>/dev/null || echo "No workspace files found"
